peg.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: a short piece of wood, metal, or plastic that is attached to a wall or fits into a hole, used especially to hang things on or to fasten things together
peg.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Sarah hung her coat on the peg.
a table fitted together with pegs
a pattern made with coloured pegs on a board
peg.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a small plastic or wooden object used to fasten wet clothes to a thin rope to dry
peg.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: a pointed piece of wood or metal that you push into the ground in order to keep a tent in the correct position
peg.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: a wooden screw used to make the strings of a violin, guitar etc tighter or looser
peg.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a small amount of strong alcoholic drink, especially whisky or brandy
peg.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: to set prices, wages etc at a particular level, or set them in relation to something else
peg.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: a currency pegged to the American dollar
peg.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to fasten something somewhere with a peg
peg.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: The tent flap was pegged open.
Outside, a woman was pegging sheets to a washing line.
peg.translation[2].definitions[0].defini: to fix something such as prices or wages at a particular level, or fix them in relation to something else
peg.translation[2].definitions[0].exampl: The prices of many holidays have been pegged at last yearâ€™s levels.
currencies which are pegged to the dollar
peg.translation[2].definitions[1].defini: to state what you believe an amount to be or what you believe will happen
peg.translation[2].definitions[1].exampl: Some analysts peg the losses at $125 million.
Opinion polls peg him as her likely successor.
